summary: Email correspondence between an Assistant United States Attorney and Patricia Anne Pileggi regarding a subpoena and the investigation into records from Mar-a-Lago. The discussion centers on Janine Gil, a former Mar-a-Lago employee, and the lack of business records from the year 2000.

persons.name: Patricia Anne Pileggi
persons.context: Email recipient and participant in scheduling a call regarding a subpoena and investigation into Mar-a-Lago records.

persons.name: Janine Gil
persons.context: Provided a document that is not considered a regular business record; she started working at Mar-a-Lago in 2007, not 2000.

connections.description: Pileggi is involved in correspondence about the subpoena and the document provided by Janine Gil regarding Mar-a-Lago.

events.title: Email Update on Mar-a-Lago Investigation
events.description: An email states that the document provided by Janine Gil does not appear to be a regular business record and that no one has been located who recalls working at Mar-a-Lago in 2000.

events.title: Scheduling of Call Regarding Subpoena
events.description: Correspondence about scheduling a call to discuss the subpoena related to Mar-a-Lago records.

keyFacts: Janine Gil provided a document related to Mar-a-Lago, but it is not considered a regular business record and she does not know who prepared it.
Janine Gil started working at Mar-a-Lago in 2007, not during the period of interest in 2000.
Investigators have been unable to locate anyone who recalls working at Mar-a-Lago in the year 2000.
The correspondence involves an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and is subject to a protective order.
The emails discuss scheduling a call regarding a subpoena, indicating an ongoing legal investigation.
